briefTitle: Collection of Bone Marrow From Donors Treated With or Without Filgrastim

interventions.name: Filgrastim
otherNames: Recombinant Methionyl Human Granulocyte Colony Stimulating Factor

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Appropriately human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-matched (HLA, A, B, DRB1 identical or antigen mismatched \[i.e., 5/6 or 6/6 antigens matched\]) sibling of the bone marrow recipient enrolled on COG-ASCT0631
* Adequate size relative to the recipient (i.e., harvesting the maximum of 20 cc/kg from the donor would result in a bone marrow graft that will provide an adequate cell and volume dose to the recipient, in the opinion of the treating physician)
* Enrolled on the COG Umbrella Long-Term Follow-Up Study COG-ALTE05N1
* Not pregnant or nursing
* No human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) positivity
* No sickle cell trait or sickle cell anemia/disease
* Not at an increased risk from bone marrow donation after filgrastim administration due to a pre-existing medical condition, as determined by an independent physician separate from the research team
* None of the following:

  * Active infection, especially pulmonary
  * Splenomegaly or a history of splenic injury
  * Active or recent pulmonary disease (i.e., pneumonia within the past 4 weeks)
  * A condition that would make the donor unsuitable to donate, as determined by an independent physician separate from the research team
* No autoimmune disease

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Short-term Adverse Events in G-CSF (Filgrastim) Stimulated Bone Marrow (G-BM) Donors
outcomeMeasures.description: The Kaplan-Meier method will be used to estimate the cumulative incidence of short term adverse events defined by having any of the following events: 1) death due to a cause that is unknown or possibly related to G-CSF, 2) development of a malignancy, 3) development of a splenic rupture, or 4) development of a severe acute lung injury possibly related to GCSF therapy.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Death in G-CSF Stimulated-bone Marrow (G-BM) Donors
outcomeMeasures.description: The Kaplan-Meier method will be used to estimate the cumulative incidence of death event in G-BM donors only.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Grade 1 or 2 Toxicities
outcomeMeasures.description: Estimate the percentage of patients having non-fatal complications of CTCAE Grades 1 or 2 in standard BM and G-CSF stimulated-bone marrow (G-BM) donors.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With Grade 3 or 4 Toxicities
outcomeMeasures.description: Estimate the percentage of patients having non-fatal complications of Grade 3 other than pain (consider Grade 4 for pain only), or any of Grade 4 in standard BM and G-CSF stimulated-bone marrow (G-BM) donors. Modified Toxicity Criteria and Pain Assessment was used with higher grades corresponding to more severe AEs.

outcomeMeasures.title: 10-year Mortality Rate in Marrow Donors
outcomeMeasures.description: The Kaplan-Meier method will be used to estimate overall survival probabilities in standard BM and G-BM donors.

outcomeMeasures.title: 10-year Overall Cancer Incidence
outcomeMeasures.description: The Kaplan-Meier method will be used to estimate overall cancer free probabilities in standard BM and G-BM donors.

outcomeMeasures.title: 10-year Hematologic Cancer Rate
outcomeMeasures.description: The Kaplan-Meier method will be used to estimate hematologic cancer probabilities in standard BM and G-BM donors.

outcomeMeasures.title: Absolute T Cell Numbers
outcomeMeasures.description: Median and interquartile range of the outcome measure in standard BM and G-BM donors.

outcomeMeasures.title: Th1 vs. Th2 Profile of T Cells
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of donors with Th1-T cell profile in standard BM and G-BM donors.

outcomeMeasures.title: Dendritic Cell (DC) Populations
outcomeMeasures.description: Median and interquartile range of the outcome measure in standard BM and G-BM donors.

outcomeMeasures.title: T Regulatory Cell Content
outcomeMeasures.description: Median and interquartile range of the outcome measure in standard BM and G-BM donors.
